title.narrative: Validation of Fine Dust Elimination Intervention (IND-6030)

description.narrative: The overall objective of this demonstration project is to eliminate an obstruction that impedes the large-scale introduction of ENS’ air purification technology to the Indian market: By validating the intervention at the AES high school, the efficacy of the technology can be demonstrated in a real-life application. In combination with the possibility to demonstrate this technology at the site of a satisfied customer, this will greatly assist in enhancing the options for successful market penetration regarding the sales of large-volume air purification systems in India.Besides the large distance, several socio-cultural factors have a large influence on business between the Netherlands and India:• unfamiliarity with each other’s culture and customs may be neutralized by mediation by a local representative,• a near-by demonstration project, and/or• an enthusiastic local customer.With the delivery of a highly optimized custom PM-abatement intervention at the AES building, ENS thought to have reached that target. However, the failure to quantify the actual on-site effectiveness threatens to nullify its potential to serve as an effective marketing tool to open the Indian market potential, by providing tangible proof of efficacy.This DHI project proposal aims to validate the intervention at the AES building to the current state-of-the-art: Hereto, highly specialized knowledge and equipment are required. This project does not literally introduce a novel technology to the target country, but aims to provide a high-quality on-site validation, in support of the large-scale introduction of this technology.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services - Dutch companies
